price_objections.objection: What if I don't stick with it?
price_objections.weak_response: You will if you have the right gear!
price_objections.strong_response: That's a really honest concern and a lot of people feel that way. Here's what I've seen: people quit when they're uncomfortable or frustrated with their gear. Starting with [specific item] that actually fits and works for you removes that barrier. Plus, we have [return policy] so you're not locked in. The bigger risk is starting with inadequate gear, having a miserable experience, and quitting because of that. What would help you feel more confident about committing?
price_objections.psychology: Validate concern, flip the risk, show how proper gear increases success likelihood, offer safety net

timing_objections.objection: I need to think about it

Would it help if I [provide specific information/hold item for 24 hours/show you comparison]? The only thing I'd mention is [genuine urgency factor if exists], but I want you to feel confident in your decision.
timing_objections.psychology: Respect the need, uncover real concern, offer concrete help, mention urgency only if genuine

timing_objections.objection: I want to wait for a sale
timing_objections.strong_response: I get that - nobody wants to overpay. Here's the reality: our next sale on [category] is typically [timeframe], and popular sizes usually sell out before then. The question is whether waiting [timeframe] is worth [savings amount] when you could be [benefit of using now]. Some people wait, some decide the time is worth more than the savings. What makes more sense for your situation?
timing_objections.psychology: Acknowledge desire to save, provide honest timeline, quantify the tradeoff, let them weigh time vs. money

trust_objections.objection: How do I know this is the right one for me?

trust_objections.psychology: Ask questions first, demonstrate personalization, show willingness to recommend against sale, offer empirical testing

trust_objections.objection: I don't know enough about this stuff to make a good decision
trust_objections.strong_response: That's exactly why I'm here - you don't need to be an expert, that's my job. Here's what I need to know from you: [simple questions about their situation]. You know your body and how you'll use it, I know the equipment. Together we'll figure out the right fit. And if it doesn't work out, [return policy]. You're not locked into a decision you don't understand.
trust_objections.psychology: Validate their expertise in their own needs, position as partnership, remove risk of wrong choice

comparison_objections.objection: What's the difference between these two options?
